newsitem.title: USA: Creative Tech unveils DVD drive for PCs.
newsitem.headline: Creative Tech unveils DVD drive for PCs.

text.p: Creative Technology Ltd on Monday said it shipped its first digital video disk, or DVD, drive for personal computers.

DVDs look like regular audio CDs but can store many more times the information. With Creative Technology's $499 DVD-drive, computer users can watch a full-length movie on their PCs. Several video game software companies plan to release DVD titles that feature lots of video, stereo sound and computer animation.
Creative, based in Singapore, said it was aiming the DVD drive at early adopters who want the latest in technology, though the company expects DVD to overtake CD-ROM sales by late next year.
Its PC-DVD kits are available at stores immediately, the company said.
